alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 11:27AM EST until January 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island...Connecticut... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. Pawcatuck River At Wood River Junction affecting Washington County. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting New London and Washington Counties. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Concord River...including Lowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Concord River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low lying areas along the Concord River will be flooded. The area most prone to flooding is a small section of Billerica along Elsie Avenue off River Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Wednesday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.6 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
